meanings.definition: To cause to happen at the same time
meanings.sent1: She is syncing her steps with the music while dancing.
meanings.sent2: The conductor is syncing the orchestra to start playing together.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized swimmers were syncing their movements perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The traffic lights are syncing to allow smooth flow of vehicles.
meanings.sent5: The dancers are syncing their movements to create a beautiful performance.

meanings.definition: To coordinate or match in time
meanings.sent1: He is syncing his schedule with his friend's for the trip.
meanings.sent2: The team is syncing their efforts to complete the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The chefs are syncing their cooking to prepare the meal together.
meanings.sent4: The runners are syncing their pace to run in harmony.
meanings.sent5: The students are syncing their presentations for the group assignment.

meanings.sent1: She is syncing her phone with her laptop to transfer photos.
meanings.sent2: The IT department is syncing the servers for data backup.
meanings.sent3: The smartwatch is syncing with the fitness app to track steps.
meanings.sent4: The GPS is syncing with the satellite for accurate location information.
meanings.sent5: The cloud service is syncing files across all devices for easy access.
